question.title: pac4j: Bad parameters type
question.body:
I get the following exception when trying to authenticate a Rest call.

  <pac4j.version>6.2.1</pac4j.version> 
  <jakartaee-pac4j.version>8.0.1</jakartaee-pac4j.version>

Any ideas?

2025-09-15 12:50:37,460|qtp1603345700-92 |DefaultSecurityLogic |DEBUG|=== SECURITY === 2025-09-15 12:50:37,461|qtp1603345700-92 |FallbackExceptionMapper |DEBUG|Handling exception.

org.pac4j.core.exception.TechnicalException: Bad parameters type
    at org.pac4j.jee.context.JEEContextFactory.newContext(JEEContextFactory.java:24)
    at org.pac4j.jee.context.JEEContextFactory.newContext(JEEContextFactory.java:13)
    at org.pac4j.core.engine.AbstractExceptionAwareLogic.buildContext(AbstractExceptionAwareLogic.java:86)
    at org.pac4j.core.engine.DefaultSecurityLogic.perform(DefaultSecurityLogic.java:81)
    at org.pac4j.jax.rs.filters.SecurityFilter.filter(SecurityFilter.java:58)
    at org.pac4j.jax.rs.filters.AbstractFilter.filter(AbstractFilter.java:49)
    at org.jboss.resteasy.core.interception.jaxrs.PreMatchContainerRequestContext.filter(PreMatchContainerRequestContext.java:276)
    at org.jboss.resteasy.core.ResourceMethodInvoker.invokeOnTarget(ResourceMethodInvoker.java:415)

answers.body: You don't need the jakartaee-pac4j module if you use the jax-rs-pac4j library.
